sketchy 1.0.2
  • Reference

Install and load packages

Source: R/load_packages.R
load_packages.Rd

load_packages installs and loads packages from different repositories.

Usage

load_packages(packages, quite = FALSE, upgrade.deps = FALSE)

Arguments

packages

Character vector with the names of the packages to be installed. The vector names indicate the repositories from which packages will be installed. If no name is included CRAN will be used as the default repository. Available repostories are: 'cran', 'github', 'gitlab', 'bitbucket' and 'bioconductor'. Note that for 'github', 'gitlab' and 'bitbucket' the string must include the user name in the form 'user/package'.

quite

Logical argument to control if package startup messages are printed. Default is FALSE (messages are printed).

upgrade.deps

Logical argument to control if package dependecies are upgraded.Default is FALSE.

Value

No object is returned.

Details

The function install and load packages from different repositories.

References

Araya-Salas, M., Willink, B., Arriaga, A. (2020), sketchy: research compendiums for data analysis in R. R package version 1.0.2.

See also

compendiums, make_compendium

Author

Marcelo Araya-Salas (marcelo.araya@ucr.ac.cr)

Examples

{
load_packages(packages = c("kableExtra", bioconductor = "ggtree", github = "maRce10/Rraven"))
}
#> Installing 1 packages: kableExtra
